text: I just could not get the sync to work. The changes I made in the design tool was not synced to local, and when uploading local changes, it cleared the template :disappointed:

To clarify, it wass the the drag and drop json files that did not sync correctly.

The steps I took was to I create the template in HubSpot first, then fetch it.

<@U6W3H6YN8> I had an issue with this last night. where my module i added fields to in the DM didnt want to sync to my local machine. OR i should say they didnt want to over write the files on my local machine using the cli.
Did you use the `--overwrite` option? <https://designers.HubSpot.com/docs/tools/local-development-reference#fetch>
ahhh.. seriously?
Any ways we could make the console messaging more clear as to why this is happening?
It isnt listed in the -h dialog either
yeah it would be nice if watch was in sync to make remote changes local as well.
bi-directional sync
reasoning is that i will create a module and add the fields then sync it down.
sometimes i need to add functionality so i have to leave watch mode and jump into fetch.
if it was watching for remote changes then i woulnt have an issue
might be a big ask considering its remote.

would be great if someone would file an issue on <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues> for this. one idea i had, is an “would you like to overwrite? y/n” prompt instead of the flag and then a way to quiet the prompt
experimenting with making the project more of a collaboration between the community and HubSpot :slightly_smiling_face:
ty
cool idea but kind of involved from a technical perspective so no promises :wink:
issue created <https://github.com/HubSpot/HubSpot-cms-tools/issues/9>
Thanks <@U22VBL87M>
yeah i figured
i was thinking like a local polling feature.. but you da boss.

Hey Will, I got it working. It’s stated, but not clearly, in the documentation that you’re creating the app in the developer account and then authorizing with the portal ID of a  CMS account. i was using the portal ID of the developer account, since that’s where the OAuth information was.
that all definitely could be written better.
Noted, thank you for the feedback cc <@UBFA10FMF>
We do recognize the authentication flow is far from ideal, we are working to make it significantly more frictionless :smile_cat:
I’ve never NOT had a problem with OAuth…. but I hold out hope that someday something will truly be frictionless.
How To Set Up Aliases for Your HS CLI Projects

probably would be…. but damn that would be awesome. because we have a couple of devs working in any given portal sometimes…. and most people can’t even follow a naming convention, let alone remember to pull down files before starting a task. LOL
<@U2H3TT8F2> <@U7SL518D6> There ya go
i finally got my dev environment set up about an hour ago and hadn’t thought that far. Great advice, Chad. I work in six portals, so i might have to make a cheat sheet of commands.
